sentences.sContent: He scanned the horizon, but there was no sign of the ship.
sentences.sCn: 他朝地平线处仔细眺望，但是找不到那艘船的踪影。

sentences.sContent: She scanned his face, looking for signs of what he was thinking.
sentences.sCn: 她端详着他的脸，想知道他在想些什么。

sentences.sContent: Video cameras scanned the car park.
All luggage has to be scanned at the airport.
sentences.sCn: 所有行李在机场都得接受扫描检查。

synos.tran: 扫描；浏览；细看；详细调查；标出格律

phrases.pCn: abbr. 检验胴体尤其是脑部新陈代谢的断层扫描（Positron Emission Tomography Scan）；正电子发射层析扫描（pet scanning）
计算机X射线轴向分层造影扫描图

words.tran: 扫描的；观测的；搜索的；扫掠的
[计] 扫描仪；扫描器；光电子扫描装置

trans.tranCn: 细看；仔细检查；粗略地看；浏览；扫描
trans.tranOther: to examine an area carefully but quickly, often because you are looking for a particular person or thing
